Who You'll Work With
You'll join us in Montreal to work closely with our clients and our Data Scientists in order to curate, transform and construct features which feed directly into our modelling approach.
This would be a hybrid client-facing/technical role using state of the art technologies, whilst also being able to communicate complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences. Who you are
A core value at QuantumBlack is fusion and at the heart of our multi-disciplinary teams is the belief that the sum of individual parts will always be less than the impact of the entire team. You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritising impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. Trust between colleagues is paramount here – you are an individual who can always be trusted to work in the best interests of all colleagues and to achieve the best outcome for QuantumBlack and our clients. You are naturally enthusiastic and enjoy sharing your passion with others.
What You'll Do
As a Senior Data Engineer at QuantumBlack in Montreal...
You will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.
Role responsibilities
Work with our clients to model their data landscape, obtain data extracts and define secure data exchange approaches
Acquire, ingest, and process data from multiple sources and systems into Big Data platforms
Understanding, assessing and mapping the data landscape.
Maintaining our Information Security standards on the engagement.
Collaborate with our data scientists to map data fields to hypotheses and curate, wrangle, and prepare data for use in their advanced analytical models.
Defining the technology stack to be provisioned by our infrastructure team.
Building modular pipeline to construct features and modelling tables.
Use new and creative techniques to deliver impact for our clients as well as internal R&D projects.
Mentoring and developing junior Data Engineers on engagements.

How successful projects on real world problems across a variety of industries are completed through referencing past deliveries of end to end pipelines.
Build products alongside the Core engineering team and evolve the engineering process to scale with data, handling complex problems and advanced client situations.
Be focused on the wrangling, clean-up and transformation of data by working alongside the Data Science team which focuses on modelling the data.
Using new technologies and problem-solving skills in a multicultural and creative environment.
You will work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of Data Scientists and Data Engineers use to progress from data to impact. You will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport.
Real-World Impact– No project is ever the same; we work across multiple sectors, providing unique learning and development opportunities internationally.
Fusing Tech & Leadership– We work with the latest technologies and methodologies and offer first class learning programmes at all levels.
Multidisciplinary Teamwork- Our teams include data scientists, engineers, project managers, UX and visual designers who work collaboratively to enhance performance.
Innovative Work Culture– Creativity, insight and passion come from being balanced. We cultivate a modern work environment through an emphasis on wellness, insightful talks and training sessions.
Striving for Diversity– With colleagues from over 40 nationalities, we recognise the benefits of working with people from all walks of life.
Our projects range from helping pharmaceutical companies bring lifesaving drugs to market quicker to optimising a Formula1 car’s performance. At QuantumBlack you have the best of both worlds; all the benefits of being part of one of the leading management consultancies globally and the autonomy to thrive in a fast growth tech culture:
Healthcare Efficiency– We helped a healthcare provider improve their clinical trial practices by identifying congestion in diagnostic testing as a key indicator of admissions breaches.
Environmental Impact– We designed and built the first data-driven application for a state of the art centre of excellence in urban innovation by collecting real-time data from environmental sensors across London and deploying proprietary analytics to find unexpected patterns in air pollution.

Job_Title: Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development
Job_Description:
[Toronto, ONTitle: Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development
Location: Toronto - Bay/Adelaide
The Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development reports into the Director, Talent Management
Title: Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development
The Independent Electricity System Operator (IESO) works at the heart of Ontario’s power system - ensuring there is enough power to meet Ontario’s power needs in real time, while also planning and securing energy for the future.
The IESO is a purpose-driven organization that seeks to attract, retain and develop a highly skilled and professional workforce. The current IESO workforce is comprised of approximately 850 employees in offices in downtown Toronto, Mississauga, and Oakville.
Powering the province requires top notch talented professionals such as engineers, analysts, project managers, cyber security specialists, communications specialists, IT experts, market operators, and data scientists. Attracting and retaining our talent requires strong programs that provide rewards, recognition, compensation and inspiration.
General Accountability:
The Manager, Employee Experience and Leadership Development is responsible for designing and leading talent management practices that will accelerate IESO’s strategy. The incumbent will partner with business leaders to build organizational capability and enhance the employee experience.
Areas of leadership include:
Developing capabilities that support the new strategy and align to employees’ careers
Creating practices that enhance the employee experience and increase commitment to the company’s purpose
Supporting leaders in growing the workforce of the future
Designing tools that increase employee input into business decisions
Establishing practices that clarify accountabilities and provide guidance so that employees excel
Key Responsibilities:
Champion a positive and engaging employee experience throughout the employee life cycle. Develop and implement practices and programs that have a meaningful impact on employees and contribute to business metrics. Examples of practices that the incumbent will lead include:
Orientation: providing employees with the knowledge and tools that will support their successful transition to IESO and validate their decision to join our organization
Employee learning and career growth: assessing and analyzing learning needs, identifying programs and practices, engaging vendors, facilitating, assisting with return on investment, and assessing impact. Establish metrics that inform IESO of appropriate levels of investment in terms of money, time, and programs.
Employee feedback and feed forward programs using pulse checks, surveys, focus groups, etc.
Establish leadership programs that are engaging and modern. Use blended learning approaches, assessment, and client input to align leadership practices to IESO’s strategy and values and equip individuals for leading the workforce of the future.
Partner with HRIS team to ensure employee practices and programs are aligned and implemented in the SuccessFactors tool to support an engaging employee experience. This will include knowledge sharing and collaborating cross functionally.
Manage the high potential program and support the Director with succession planning so that IESO has a robust talent pool for future business needs. Approach to this program may include facilitating learning programs, assessing leadership skills, providing feedback, and developing individual growth plans.
Research and recommend frameworks, processes, and practices that enhance employee connection, commitment, and contribution to IESO. Examples include performance planning and measurement, competencies, mentorship, and development planning. Responsibilities include communicating initiatives, collaborating with colleagues, leaders and employees, and situational coaching. Drive decisions and reinforce practices in areas of responsibility.
Establishes communities of practice within the IESO to map out career paths, elevate learning programs, and build technical, interpersonal or business competencies. Demonstrate a client-focused, consultative, and continuous improvement orientation to enhance organizational capability to achieve IESO’s mandate and strategic priorities.
Support IESO in fostering the culture that will support the strategy. Implement change practices that address organizational opportunities and generate employee commitment. Collaborate with the Diversity and Inclusion Committee. Draw linkages between cultural initiatives and business metrics.
Establish measurement and assessment programs to report on:
Organizational performance
Individual performance
Manage logistics associated with responsibilities including budget, vendor management, procurement processes program set up, and client communications.

Selection Criteria:
University degree in Psychology, Behavioural Sciences, Human Resources or equivalent required.
Master’s Degree in Industrial/Organizational Development Psychology, Adult Learning, or Leadership and Learning preferred
Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in senior learning and/or organizational development roles
Knowledge, skill and experience in the following: Leadership Development, Group/Team effectiveness, Career/Development Planning, High Potential programs, and culture
Strong knowledge of psychometric assessment tools
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain, influence, listen, instruct, give clear feedback, and ask insightful questions
Very strong facilitation skills with a proven ability to bring a group to resolution, decision, or conclusion
Very strong coaching skills gained by engaging in coaching activities with individuals at all levels of an organization
Very strong learning background (especially adult learning theories and practices) with the judgement to determine when learning is (not) the appropriate solution to a situation
Ability to assess organizational or individual situations and determine appropriate practices
Ability to assess business priorities and determine appropriate learning or organizational development intervention
Experience working with Learning Management Platforms/HRIS integrated systems
Experience with the development of eLearning content and blending learning approaches
Competencies:
Action Oriented
Conflict Management
Comfort Around Higher Management
Presentation Skills
Dealing with Ambiguity
Informing
Motivating Others
Organizational Agility
What the IESO Offers:
Competitive market wages
Comprehensive benefit programs
Programs and policies to support a balanced lifestyle
A challenging fast-paced team environment
Opportunity to work with some of the brightest people in the industry
Deadline for submitting your application is October 4, 2019 at 11:59 PM EST
While we appreciate your submissions, we regret that we can only contact those candidates selected for interviews.
We thank all candidates for their interest in opportunities with the IESO. Be sure to follow us on LinkedIn .
The IESO is an equal opportunity employer.

Job_Title: SENIOR DIRECTOR OF R&D, FOOD TECHNOLOGY
Job_Description:
[Delta, BCDelta, BC Annacis Island
ABOUT THE ROLE
The position will be regarded as a key expert in microwave vacuum (REV) dehydration technology, in both raw material preparation and formulation techniques and drying process optimizations.

The candidate will design and conduct experiments, collaborate with external partners and internal teams to execute projects, seek and pursue opportunities for IP, and regularly update project status to the superiors.

You will support specific partner projects and be responsible for developing technical materials, sample prototypes and formulations, and documentation. You will lead, support and work along with a group of experienced food scientists and process technologists.

Core Duties:
Serving as key technical expert for REV dehydration including product preparation, formulation, processing and evaluation.
Innovating in REV process by creating new snacks or ingredients that reduce the cost of production, are nutritionally superior, easy to process and/or provide increased functionality in the end product.
Crafting and conducting experiments to evaluate potential applications and processes for new and emerging opportunities.
Working collaboratively with sales and marketing team to drive progress on key short and long-term projects.
Working with external business partners and research institutes to fast track new process development and build our team’s capability
Preparing and delivering high quality internal and external training documentations, presentations, and technical documentation to demonstrate and communicate technology and product performances.
Communicating to senior leadership and business partners about the status, key insights and conclusions of on-going project work.
Helping to lead the R&D team by coordinating work streams.
Keeping appropriate records to support both internal and external activities and projects.
Presenting work, capabilities and knowledge at conferences, installation training, and customer/partner meetings.
QUALIFICATIONS:
PhD in Food Science, Biosystems Engineering or related discipline with 1-3 years of relevant work experience with food dehydration technology.
MS degree with a minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in the same area will also be considered.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (word, excel, and power-point)
ABOUT YOU
High level of expertise with hands-on product development with laboratory and/or pilot plant equipment is a must.
Excellent verbal and written technical communication skills e.g. making presentations and writing technical reports.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and interact with cross-functional teams.
Flexibility to work off-hours
10-20% travel required to attend trade shows, conferences, and training at partner sites.
Experience with the entire lifecycle of a food product, from translating the bench-top products to pilot plants and finally to large-scale production.
Deep understanding of food safety GMP and HACCP, specifically related to drying processes
Track record of proven experience with experiment design, statistical data analysis, and interpretation of results desired.
Job Type: Full-time

hOW TO APPLY
Email a resume with a cover letter and a list of references to John Zhang (jzhang@enwave.net) with the subject line ‘’Application – Senior Director’’]

acceptance criteria and test plans.
functional specifications.
user acceptance test plans and test scenarios.

For agile projects, act as the product owner, and collaborate with the team to articulate user stories and acceptance criteria, holding the team to a high level of quality through challenging assumptions and supporting the sprint demos.

At least 5 to 7 years’ experience as a Business Analyst in a multi-disciplinary technology environment or IT projects.
Minimum BSc/BCom/BCS or related degree. MSc, MBA or PMP is a distinct asset.

A client-focused mindset with proven experience building strong working relationships with executive sponsors, senior leaders and business stakeholders.
Tangible track record of leveraging strategic analysis and decision support to identify solutions that improved financial and operating performance.
Strong organizational and time management skills accompanied by good judgment in order to prioritize, project manage and work independently in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.
Exceptional communication skills (written, oral, presentation) and interpersonal skills with proven experience building strong relationships at all levels including ability to influence, motivate and facilitate consensus.
Desire to work in a high growth, dynamic and young company culture.

Effective decision making and delegation skills.
Confident, results-oriented individual; lead by example and demonstrate a ‘can do’ attitude.

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. About BenchSci
We empower the world's scientists to run more successful experiments to accelerate drug discovery.

With a 50% failure rate, inappropriate antibodies waste millions of research dollars and delay novel therapies by months. BenchSci’s AI solves this problem by continuously reading biomedical papers like a PhD biologist to understand which antibodies have been successfully used in which experiments. Unlike traditional antibody search tools, BenchSci uses comprehensive data, proprietary machine learning models, sophisticated bioinformatics and ontologies, proprietary image recognition technology, and a unique interface to increase confidence in antibody selection. This reduces the cost of research and increases its impact for over 31,000 scientists at more than 3,600 academic institutions and 15 of the top 20 pharmaceutical companies that trust BenchSci to guide their experiment design.

Here at BenchSci, these are our core values:

Focused: We focus on what will drive the greatest impact at all times.
Advancement: We believe in continuous growth, and discovering new ways to do things better. This applies to our product and business, but also to ourselves.
Speed: We recognize that without a sense of urgency, our team, our product and our mission lose their value.
Tenacity: What we’re trying to do isn’t easy, but we hire the best people, and give them the autonomy, tools, and resources to succeed. The hard work is up to them.
Transparency: We believe that sharing diverse ideas and information creates strong teams. Our success stems from research, collaboration, feedback, and trust.

BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our cofounders are immigrants to Canada, as are many of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.]

[Vancouver, BCWhat you’ll be doing…

We enable people to transform data into something visual and understandable, enabling people to make important decisions based on those insights. If you are passionate about technology, but also care deeply about doing something meaningful, Tableau is the place for you.
With large deployments of Tableau, containing millions of visualizations, we need to provide people with tools to find the data that is important to them. No matter how good our platform is at showing meaningful and beautiful visualizations, they can’t have an impact if they cannot be found. We are building a brand new team to focus exclusively on content discoverability through search. This team will help more people see and understand their data by making it very easy to find the data and visualizations they’re looking for.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include …
This role will have the opportunity to spearhead this new initiative, driving towards a unified search experience in the Tableau ecosystem. You would be working closely with our data scientists to use machine learning and advanced search algorithms to create meaningful search results in our products. In order to be successful, this role requires you to be comfortable with ambiguity, rapid prototyping, digging through legacy code, modern architectural design patterns, mixed (SaaS/On Prem) deployments, scaling and security concerns, and ideally, have worked with search and relevancy before. You are not expected to be a research engineer (we have those), but rather a very strong enterprise/SaaS Java developer who can work with large scale systems.
Who you are…
Relentlessly High Standards . Your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality even under schedule pressure. You believe in automation and writing tests for your own code as a way of maintaining high quality in your products. “Good enough” is never good enough!
Coding Rockstar . You understand what it takes to write highly scalable enterprise and consumer software that is used by millions of people. You love writing code that "just works" - that is reliable, scalable, and secure. You think far enough ahead to avoid tech debt, but know how to avoid over-engineering. You are agile and can prototype, learn, adapt, and pivot as needed.
Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others (including across disciplines) so we all become better. You’ve been a technical leader and really enjoy mentoring and leading projects and technical excellence within the team. You are comfortable debating challenging problems, know when to disagree and commit, and don’t let ego get in the way of getting the work done.
Experienced. You are a Java expert and have years (10+) of experience with large scale Java systems, having worked with a variety of common frameworks and libraries popular in Java shops (e.g. Spring and Hibernate). You’ve worked with a variety of database technologies with very large datasets and understand how to optimize for maximum performance and scale. You understand the various layers of the software stack, know where to utilize code, when to use caching, when to leverage the database or event bus to create a highly performant system. You understand microservice design patterns very well and how to create loosely coupled SaaS systems. You’ve also worked with on premise deployed projects.
Motivated. You do good work, and lots of it, and not because your boss is watching…the drive to deliver is just a part of you. You aren’t a clock watcher, but are focused on getting your best work done.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!

You would be working closely with the research scientists on other teams to use machine learning and advanced search algorithms to create highly relevant search results in our products. In order to be successful, this role requires you to be comfortable with ambiguity, rapid prototyping, and working with senior enterprise developers to create production worthy code.
Who you are…
Relentlessly High Standards . Your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality even under schedule pressure. You believe in automation and writing tests for your own code as a way of maintaining high quality in your products. “Good enough” is never good enough!
Search Relevancy Enthusiast . You understand the search problem deeply and all the related challenges. You know how to use specific algorithms, measure search relevance, and collect data to create highly relevant search results. You know where ML (machine learning) fits into this picture, where search indexes play a role, and how to use ranking services to increase search relevancy.
Coder. While your passion is research, you’re also a rock solid coder, who knows how to get scalable, quality, production worthy code out the door. You’ve made the connection between theoretical code and real-world code and know how to translate your ideas into shippable products. You’ve worked in Python (preferably also with Java) and aren’t afraid of the terminal.
Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others (including across disciplines) so we all become better. You’ve experienced working with senior enterprise developers to turn your research ideas into highly scalable enterprise solutions.
Experienced. You have a very deep understanding of search related algorithms. You understand state of the art information retrieval techniques and have expertise on how to use natural language to yield highly relevant results. You have worked with machine learning in a production environment and know when and where to use it to help solve real world business problems.
Motivated. You do good work, and lots of it, and not because your boss is watching…the drive to deliver is just a part of you. You aren’t a clock watcher, but are focused on getting your best work done.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!
#LI-NF1
Tableau Software is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Tableau Software is a company on a mission. We help people see and understand their data. After a highly successful IPO in 2013, Tableau has become a market-defining company in the business intelligence industry. Our culture is casual and high-energy. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!]

Marketmuse Inc. is a rapidly growing institutionally-backed content planning technology firm with offices in Montreal, Boston, and New York City. Design and implement scalable machine learning solutions geared towards solving natural language processing, knowledge representation, and natural language generation problems

[Montréal, QCABOUT HOPPER

At Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app - one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.

Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015.

Take off with us!

THE ROLE

A stellar opportunity to have massive impact: join the rapidly growing team at a company continually redefining how people travel. As Senior Software Developer, you will be directly responsible for many of the innovative features we’ll be working on, whether collaborating with our outstanding design and product team or helping our data science group work on the bleeding-edge technology to personalize travel for our ever expanding population of members.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:

Build innovative consumer experiences, setting standards for code and performance
Create delightful user experiences in our app (iOS or Android)
Work in a complex dynamic environment with a rich API tier
Collaborate with a diverse group of people, giving and receiving feedback for growth
Execute on big opportunities, helping Hopper rise to the top of the travel industry

A PERFECT CANDIDATE HAS:

Thrived in mobile technologies and delivered delightful user experience at scale
The ability to bring leading industry techniques and technologies to the table
Experience mentoring and leading people at different stages in their career
Excelled in cross-functional teams, working fluidly with Product Managers, Data Scientists, Mobile Developers, and other highly skilled specialists
A passionate focus on quality, writing testable code that performs well for our consumers
ABOUT THE TEAM

Our development team cares deeply about the growth and success of Hopper, and tries to deliver the best possible experience we can to our more than 40 million users. Work on an award winning product that our customers love and continue to find exceptionally useful in a market and space that is continually growing every year.

BENEFITS

Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options
Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans
Access to a 401k (Boston) or Retirement Savings Plan (Montreal)
Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass
IATA Travel Agent Card for discounts in the travel industry
Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy)
In Cambridge, work in a historic factory building near Kendall Square; in Montreal, work in an artist’s loft in the Mile End
Team lunches, offsite activities and much more!]

[Toronto, ONTell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Engineering covers a broad range of exercises and initiatives including requirements gathering, design specification, industry analysis, vendor engagement and analysis, software development, project management, financial management, test plans and execution, and operational standards implementation. Our highly-coveted Engineers are interspersed amongst many areas of focus: innovation, design, execution, maintenance, strategy, portfolio management. We call all of these things incredible learning opportunities and no two assignments are ever the same.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Description
About This Role
We are looking for world-class engineers to help us develop a system that will serve as the main interface to our machine learning platform. The goal of this system is to help in all stages of model development, from feature engineering all the way to production monitoring.

We empower our data scientists to build better models by helping them understand the data and trained models. We also provide the tools necessary for analyzing and visualizing machine learning algorithms in an effort to extract valuable business insights in a transparent and comprehensive manner.

As Senior Full Stack Engineer at Layer 6, you'll work with data scientists to learn about different machine learning algorithms and ways to analyze them. On the backend, you'll work with the team to architect systems and design a REST API for the front-end web application, while on the front-end, you'll build intuitive interfaces to visualize data and answer questions about machine learning models.

You'll also have the opportunity to work with the engineering team to tackle the challenge of developing high performance, robust and scalable systems.
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD & Layer 6? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
BSc+ in Computer Science or similar
5+ years of programming experience
Proven experience in designing and delivering a large web application
Experience as a key contributor and leader on projects
Strong experience in Java or JavaScript (or other front-end languages)
Extensive experience with at least one front-end framework (React, Elm, etc.)
Passionate about creating a great user experience
Strong desire to learn
What we consider an asset:

Experience in building a web app in Elm
Experience with functional programming
Experience with Elasticsearch
Familiarity with data analysis or machine learning
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Comfortable with math (linear algebra, calculus)
Additional Information
Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

About BenchSci
We empower the world's scientists to run more successful experiments to accelerate drug discovery.

With a 50% failure rate, inappropriate antibodies waste millions of research dollars and delay novel therapies by months. BenchSci’s AI solves this problem by continuously reading biomedical papers like a PhD biologist to understand which antibodies have been successfully used in which experiments. Unlike traditional antibody search tools, BenchSci uses comprehensive data, proprietary machine learning models, sophisticated bioinformatics and ontologies, proprietary image recognition technology, and a unique interface to increase confidence in antibody selection. This reduces the cost of research and increases its impact for over 31,000 scientists at more than 3,600 academic institutions and 15 of the top 20 pharmaceutical companies that trust BenchSci to guide their experiment design.

Here at BenchSci, these are our core values:

Focused: We focus on what will drive the greatest impact at all times.
Advancement: We believe in continuous growth, and discovering new ways to do things better. This applies to our product and business, but also to ourselves.
Speed: We recognize that without a sense of urgency, our team, our product and our mission lose their value.
Tenacity: What we’re trying to do isn’t easy, but we hire the best people, and give them the autonomy, tools, and resources to succeed. The hard work is up to them.
Transparency: We believe that sharing diverse ideas and information creates strong teams. Our success stems from research, collaboration, feedback, and trust.

BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our cofounders are immigrants to Canada, as are many of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.]

Job_Title: Innovation Manager (Concept Design)- Canada Goose Innovation Lab
Job_Description:
[Toronto, ONPosition Overview:
Our goal of the Innovation LAB is to enhance and support the company Core Values as a Product Led, Function First brand while retaining Canada Goose’s unique culture and point of view. This is a unique opportunity to impact Canada Goose’s innovation agenda. The Innovation Manager (Concept Design) is a critical role within the Innovation LAB team responsible for leading opportunity identification, research and insights gathering, building business cases, product ideation, validation to commercialisation and business adoption.


The Goose Advanced Innovation Map – GAIM represents a broad portfolio of industry-leading short and long-term initiatives related products, platforms and technologies, established and governed by the Goose Advanced Innovation Team – GAIT. The Innovation Manager (Concept Design) spearheads key initiatives that will help protect Canada Goose’s market leadership by transforming ambiguous innovation ideas into sustained new value for the business.


The Innovation Manager interacts internally and externally with a highly technical, interdisciplinary group of forward-thinking scientists, engineers, designers, developers, manufacturing and sourcing professionals both internally and externally. This role requires working cross-functionally with various functions within design & merchandising as well as consumer insights, strategy, brand marketing, retail and other business units to launch new innovations.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop design-thinking and research capabilities to define and elevate innovation initiatives
Identify opportunities for future innovation initiatives in the context of the overall Canada Goose Advanced Innovation MAP Roadmap
Conduct primary and secondary human insights research through existing methodologies including customer surveys, interview and wear testing protocols
Implement and facilitate innovation tools and frameworks to arrive at a defined innovation business case and brief
Be aware of future trends and cultural movements and link them back to CG.
Liaise and collaborate closely with cross-functional partners and key executive stakeholders to develop, establish and continually evolve our innovation portfolio
Manage and execute on innovation initiatives from ideation to commercialisation
Leads and co-leads innovation projects at all stages of the innovation process to enable continual progress towards our delivery commitments
Synthesizes insights across sources and data points and transform them into key conclusions, compelling business stories, and strategic recommendations
Builds, presents and drives-forward innovation business cases which are defined by unique market opportunities in line with Canada Goose’s innovation agenda
Executes and manages timeline around delivery of proof-of-concept innovations including component and system testing in both laboratory and contextual environments (wear testing)
Drives proof-of-concept prototypes to commercialisation through in line partnerships and GTM (Go To Market) process
Identifies and works with relevant world-class vendors and consultants to accelerate our innovation agenda
Participate and present during Goose Advance Innovation Team (GAIT) quarterly updates when requested
Establish and deliver excellence in Design
Ability to Create graphic representation of proof-of-concept samples
Works with required creative partners to establish visual designs for innovation concepts
Ensures products are engineered to Canada Goose’s Quality and Production standards.
Provides feedback to Design on construction challenges and recommend alternatives or improvements.
Provides information of technical details to Product Developers as required.
Manages and create mock ups with advanced prototyping team in a timely manner when required.
Communicate and liaise with QA of key elements in design and construction.
Work closely with the Advanced Prototype Technician
Experience, Education and Designations:
Design or Industrial Design Education
Undergraduate degree required, advanced degree preferred
5 years of professional experience in innovation-based role, ideally with a focus in project leadership on customer-driven design thinking, industrial design, product design/development, digital or graphic design
Experience in product-led brand, particularly in outerwear is an asset
Experience leading high-dynamic teams and cross-functional relationships across a face-paced business
Advanced knowledge of garment construction, pattern making, prototyping is an asset
Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:
Strong ability to work from scratch, from first prototype sample through to inline adoption
Clearly communicate with the inline Product Development and Engineering team to ensure successful handover and adoption to the inline collection, including accessibility for feedback and opportunities for key learnings.
Extended knowledge and interests in new construction methods and manufacturing technology
Experience with outerwear garments is an must
Should be organized, detail oriented, team player, multi-task oriented
Demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently
Ability to prioritize day to day work activities according to the department/business needs and Goose Advanced Innovation Team deadlines and quarterly updates
Ability to work as a team and maintain a high level of professionalism and discretion
Excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.
Knowledge of Illustrator helpful
Able to work in a fast-paced environment while meeting the demands of many different departments (Production, Product Development, Cutting, Quality Assurance).
Consistently exhibits Canada Goose’s Values, taking pride in being innovative, respectful, passionate, accountable, and entrepreneurial while exhibiting personal commitment
We truly thank all applicants for their interest in joining the Goose Team, but only those candidates considered for an initial interview will be contacted.
Canada Goose Inc. is committed to delivering and improving accessibility in employment for all persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available, upon request, in the application and interview process and in the course of all other methods of selection of employees. Successful candidates for employment will be introduced to and trained in respect of all of Canada Goose Inc.’s human rights, accommodation and accessibility polices.]

Description

About BenchSci
We empower the world's scientists to run more successful experiments to accelerate drug discovery.

With a 50% failure rate, inappropriate antibodies waste millions of research dollars and delay novel therapies by months. BenchSci’s AI solves this problem by continuously reading biomedical papers like a PhD biologist to understand which antibodies have been successfully used in which experiments. Unlike traditional antibody search tools, BenchSci uses comprehensive data, proprietary machine learning models, sophisticated bioinformatics and ontologies, proprietary image recognition technology, and a unique interface to increase confidence in antibody selection. This reduces the cost of research and increases its impact for over 31,000 scientists at more than 3,600 academic institutions and 15 of the top 20 pharmaceutical companies that trust BenchSci to guide their experiment design.

Here at BenchSci, these are our core values:

Focused: We focus on what will drive the greatest impact at all times.
Advancement: We believe in continuous growth, and discovering new ways to do things better. This applies to our product and business, but also to ourselves.
Speed: We recognize that without a sense of urgency, our team, our product and our mission lose their value.
Tenacity: What we’re trying to do isn’t easy, but we hire the best people, and give them the autonomy, tools, and resources to succeed. The hard work is up to them.
Transparency: We believe that sharing diverse ideas and information creates strong teams. Our success stems from research, collaboration, feedback, and trust.

BenchSci is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. All four of our cofounders are immigrants to Canada, as are many of our employees. We welcome your fresh perspectives and ideas.]

Job_Title: Senior Hydrogeologist / Scientist or Environmental Engineer
Job_Description:
[Saskatoon, SKAre you looking for a home for the best years of your career? A place where you can contribute to a dynamic employee-owned firm, tackle challenging project work, and collaborate with industry recognized professionals? Geosyntec is the place for you! We are seeking an exceptional senior hydrogeologist / scientist/ environmental engineer to help grow our contaminated site assessment, remediation and mining practices in Saskatoon, SK. This position is well-suited for a talented, highly experienced individual who is interested in being a leader and contributing to innovative and challenging projects. Our client base includes a diverse mix of industrial, institutional and governmental clients.
Our clients ask us to address their new ventures and most challenging problems involving the environment, property redevelopment and natural resources. Geosyntec is internationally known for its technical leadership, broad experience, and exceptional client service. Learn more by visiting www.geosyntec.com.
ABOUT THE POSITION:
Is this the right position to help you achieve your professional goals? We expect that you’d work on a variety of challenging technical projects and leverage your existing relationships to help Geosyntec expand its current practices and capabilities.
Collaboration and mentoring are cornerstones of Geosyntec’s culture. You should expect to work closely with experienced professionals who will help integrate you into Geosyntec’s culture as you advance to this next stage of your career. Some of the task-level or project management responsibilities you will be asked to do include:
Business development; including bringing in new clients and obtaining repeat business from existing clients, leading proposal preparation, and developing and implementing a business development plan;
Task and project management, including planning and implementing investigation and remediation projects, budgeting and budget management, adherence to schedule, quality, client satisfaction, and profitability;
Management and mentoring of junior staff and managing subcontractors;
Work plan development, data evaluation, and report writing;
Preparing technical reports, letters, memoranda, plans, specifications, and proposals;
Reviewing and managing written document production;
Preparing for and participating in meetings with clients, regulatory personnel, and other parties; and
At times, job may also include fieldwork including site inspections, multi-media environmental sampling and characterization, drilling oversight, contractor oversight, and remediation system operations, maintenance, and construction.
Here are some other things you should know about these positions:
Training: This position requires health and safety, first aid, and CPR training and medical monitoring, as required, paid for by the firm. We also offer professional development opportunities including technical conferences, in-house seminars, webinars, and mentoring, that allow our professionals to build the technical and business skills necessary to become successful consultants.
Overnight travel: Up to 20%
Your success is our success. We encourage our professionals to continually develop their interests and skills. Advancement is based on an individual’s own performance and initiative.
CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS:
BSc. in Science/Geology or Engineering (environmental preferred). (required)
Advanced degree (MS, PhD) in the same. (preferred)
8 to 10 years of direct environmental consulting experience in the Western Canadian marketplace. (required)
Experience with multi-disciplinary project teams. (required)
Demonstrated success in the development and management of clients. (required)
Excellent leadership skills. (required)
Excellent technical writing skills. (required)
Professional certification (i.e., P.Geo. or P.Eng.) (strongly desired).
Ability to succeed in a fast-paced consulting environment, handling multiple project assignments, meeting strict deadlines, and traveling to client facilities as needed. (required)
Valid driver’s license and a satisfactory driving record. (required)
WHAT DOES IT TAKE TO BE SUCCESSFUL AT GEOSYNTEC?
Geosyntec strives to hire and retain the best and brightest people in their fields. We look for exceptional interpersonal skills, communication skills, and problem-solving abilities, plus the passion for technical excellence and quality. We seek individuals with leadership potential, a commitment to lifelong learning and growth, and the desire to build a long and rewarding career with a growing Firm.
WHY CHOOSE GEOSYNTEC?
Geosyntec is a great place to build a career. If you're looking for an exciting place to work, a place with challenging and rewarding projects, and a place that has been nationally recognized for its employees' quality of life, technical expertise, and business success, then Geosyntec may be the place for you. You can learn more about careers and employment at Geosyntec by visiting http://www.geosyntec.com/careers/
Geosyntec offers excellent compensation packages commensurate with experience, along with a comprehensive employee benefits package.
Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

[Toronto, ONDo you love building intuitive UX and maintainable applications? Have strong opinions about clean URLs and dirty objects in validation libraries? We want to talk to you!

Beeswax is looking for a Senior Web Engineer - Frontend to join our growing team. We were recently recognized on the Inc. 5000 list as #46 in the fastest growing companies and #5 in the top software companies. In 2018, we were also named by Business Insider as the "fastest growing company in AdTech".

At Beeswax, we make great advertising software. Beeswax created the Bidder-as-a-Service™ concept because we believe that every advertiser should have power, flexibility, and transparency when buying advertising programmatically. So come join the team and help us take our customers into the next generation of Real-Time Bidding.

Our company is an easy to use, massive scale and high availability advertising platform founded by industry veterans who worked together at Google. We're well funded by leading VCs, such as RRE and Foundry Group, and are rapidly expanding our customer list and our engineering team. We offer our customers the most extensible and transparent advertising platform in the world and process millions of transactions per second.

Our engineers come from major tech companies such as Amazon and Facebook as well as many other companies with strong software disciplines. We take pride in our mission to build great advertising software.

Our tech stack is constantly evolving to meet the challenges of the massive scale of transactions on which we operate. To manage the firehose of data coming in, we explore complex tradeoffs and carefully architect high performance distributed systems. Those in turn require elegant and thoughtfully designed interfaces to make the systems accessible to both our team and our customers.

What You'll Be Doing:

Work on a JS application built on top of the API that our customers use to configure our systems
Drive major architectural changes as we scale to improve our engineering velocity (we're moving from Backbone to React)
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, designers and data scientists to evolve these services to provide new experiences for our customers as well as meet our ever-growing scale
Guide and mentor other engineers on architecture and process
Do fun tasks like reviewing code, writing design docs and closing JIRA tickets

Who You Are:

5+ years of web engineering experience at strong software companies
Experience building JS applications in more than one well known framework
Comfort with and an understanding of relational databases (we use Amazon Aurora MySQL)
A solid understanding of modern operational processes and concerns for web applications (deployment, provisioning, monitoring)
A strong grasp of software architecture (from classes or self-learning)
An appreciation (or tolerance of) bee puns
An ability to think about and tackle problems analytically

Successful Engineers at Beeswax Have:

An ethic of service and a belief in putting the customer first
A powerful sense of pragmatism to figure out what needs to be done right versus right now
A curiosity about technology and a desire to use it to solve problems in all sorts of domains
An openness to feedback and more than just the spelling skills to know that there's no I in Team
An appreciation of repeatability, resilience, observability, and operational simplicity

We believe in using the right tools for the job so our products are built in a variety of languages including C++, Java, Javascript, Python and PHP. While engineers tend to specialize in their specific domains everyone on our team needs to have a solid understanding of computing fundamentals and modern approaches to building high scale and high quality software.]

[Toronto, ONJob Description
Research Director
Thomson Reuters is the Answer Company™. We provide authoritative content, advanced technologies and human expertise to help our customers find trusted answers. We enable professionals in the legal, tax and accounting, and media markets to make the decisions that matter most, all powered by the world's most trusted news organization.
Thomson Reuters is at the forefront of developing technology that will change how professionals access and use information by interacting with smart applications. At the Center for AI and Cognitive Computing, we are a team of scientists, engineers and designers focusing on the development of smart applications by applying and extending state of the art in natural language processing, machine learning, deep learning, information retrieval, knowledge representation and reasoning, data mining, text analytics and human-computer interactions.
We are looking for a Director of Research in our Toronto, Canada offices. Because we believe scientists want to continue to be scientists, this is both an individual contributor and a leadership role. This role is for you because you want to do applied research in one or more of our focus areas, because you want to build applications that are used by professionals around the world, and do so while leading a team of scientists and engineers and keep your creative side active by collaborating with product developers who are busy designing the next generation of products for our markets.

Design, implement and validate algorithms at scale to solve challenging real world problem

Proficient programming skills in a high-level language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

As a recognized leader in disciplined agile and lean software development practices, Pivotal combines the Silicon Valley state of mind, modern approach, and infrastructure with organizations' core expertise and values. Our cloud-native platform and suite of data tools drive software innovation for many of the world's most admired brands, helping enterprises move at start-up speeds and with greater business agility. We optimize for change and teach next-generation developers to create and build new solutions, and are committed to open source and open standards.

Our methodology is about evolving, in both development and innovation, and our culture is empowering. Our 2,000+ employees across offices worldwide subscribe to an ethos of kindness. We make a point to bring empathy to each and every project, and are guided by a purposeful mission—to transform how the world builds software.

Pivotal's Cloud Native platform drives software innovation for many of the world's most admired brands. With millions of developers in communities around the world, Pivotal technology touches billions of users every day. After shaping the software development culture of Silicon Valley's most valuable companies for over a decade, today Pivotal leads a global technology movement transforming how the world builds software.

---
YOU
---

You are unique: as a curious, passionate, engaging, hands-on architect you will help customers realize the benefits of cloud native applications and architectures on Pivotal Cloud Foundry. You will also work closely with the Pivotal Cloud Foundry engineering and platform architect teams to transform the way our customers build and run their software.

--
US
--

Our mission is to make customers' use of our products and solutions successful, so that they can more effectively transform their business. Our cross-disciplinary team includes technical account leaders, data scientists, agile specialists, solutions architects, educators on Pivotal technology, and business transformation specialists.

--------
YOUR DAY
--------

In this role, you will:

Work on small, focused projects (typically 6 or 10 weeks) in our office and/or at a customer location as part of a balanced team of architects, product managers and business people
Help customers realize unprecedented returns by transforming existing applications, across a vast spectrum of complexity, language and framework types, to run using Cloud Native patterns and practices
Coach and mentor customer developers, architects, product owners and operations people as we use agile/XP and techniques like TDD and CI/CD
Continuously learn and be at the leading edge of Pivotal and industry trends

------------------
KEY QUALIFICATIONS
------------------

You are unique: as an exceptional, passionate, customer facing, hands-on architect you will help customers transform to realize the benefits of cloud native applications and architectures on Pivotal Cloud Foundry. You will also work closely with the Spring and Pivotal Cloud Foundry engineering teams to:


Provide feedback on – and contributions to – the Spring and Cloud Foundry open source projects, potentially becoming a core committer
Assist Pivotal's customers in migrating existing apps to Pivotal Cloud Foundry
Modernize customer applications, incrementally improving infrastructure and app architecture techniques
Work with Pivotal's customers to architect and build new cloud native apps
Become an agent of change within customer organizations
You are required to be available and willing to travel at least 60% to customer locations

------------
IDEAL SKILLS
------------


8+ years of software development experience
You are a Java expert, with experience and familiarity building modern Spring applications with Spring Boot; you have a strong background with Spring and related projects
Experience building distributed / service oriented / microservice-style and cloud based application architectures
Have an understanding of – or implementation experience in – building Twelve-Factor applications, and using Domain Driven Design
You are a great written and verbal communicator, capable of public speaking and presenting in front of customers, at user groups, etc.
Comfortable in new situations with new clients
Experience building enterprise applications, including integration with COTS systems
You are an Agile practitioner, familiar with extreme programming, test driven development, pairing, continuous integration, continuous delivery, and related techniques

----------------
PREFERRED SKILLS
----------------


You are a polyglot programmer (you might have used JavaEE, C#, Go, etc.)
Experience integrating with Netflix OSS components (Eureka, Hystrix, Ribbon, etc.)
Experience with Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes

Pivotal is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that will consider all qualified applicants, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.]

In-depth knowledge of Python programming leveraging Django framework
A solid understanding of relational databases (we use Amazon Aurora MySQL)
A solid understanding of modern operational processes and concerns for web applications (deployment, provisioning, monitoring)
A strong grasp of software architecture (from classes or self-learning)
An appreciation (or tolerance of) bee puns
An ability to think about and tackle problems analytically

Successful Engineers at Beeswax Have:

An ethic of service and a belief in putting the customer first
A powerful sense of pragmatism to figure out what needs to be done right versus right now
A curiosity about technology and a desire to use it to solve problems in all sorts of domains
An openness to feedback and more than just the spelling skills to know that there's no I in Team
An appreciation of repeatability, resilience, observability, and operational simplicity

We believe in using the right tools for the job so our products are built in a variety of languages including C++, Java, Javascript, Python (Django) and PHP. While engineers tend to specialize in their specific domains everyone on our team needs to have a solid understanding of computing fundamentals and modern approaches to building high scale and high quality software.]

Job_Title: Senior Business Analyst, Decision Analytics Services (.Net Developer)
Job_Description:
[Toronto, ONOverview
Senior Business Analyst (.Net Developer)

EXL (NASDAQ:EXLS) is a leading operations management and analytics company that helps businesses enhance growth and profitability in the face of relentless competition and continuous disruption. Using our proprietary, award-winning Business EXLerator Framework™, which integrates analytics, automation, benchmarking, BPO, consulting, industry best practices and technology platforms, we look deeper to help companies improve global operations, enhance data-driven insights, increase customer satisfaction, and manage risk and compliance. Headquartered in New York, New York, EXL has more than 24,000 professionals in locations throughout the United States, Europe, Asia (primarily India and Philippines), Latin America, Australia and South Africa.

EXL Analytics provides data-driven, action-oriented solutions to business problems through statistical data mining, cutting edge analytics techniques and a consultative approach. Our global footprint of nearly 2,000 data scientists and analysts assist client organizations with complex risk minimization methods, advanced marketing, pricing and CRM strategies, internal cost analysis, and cost and resource optimization within the organization. EXL Analytics serves the insurance, healthcare, banking, capital markets, utilities, retail and e-commerce, travel, transportation and logistics industries.

 Development of applications on .NET Technologies: C# .NET Core 1.0/2.0, .NET 3.5/4.5, ASP/ADO.Net, MVC , Programming Language: C#, C++, C, SQL, Scripting Languages Any : JavaScript, jQuery,SSIS/SSRS Contribute to how analytical approach is structured for specification of analysis Contribute insights from conclusions of analysis that integrate with initial hypothesis and business objective. [Toronto, ONAbout Us:
---------

We are a well-funded, hyper-growth, Canada-based start-up looking for an all-star Engineering Lead. If you've dreamed about being a key member of a fast-growth company on the ground floor, this is your chance.

Some details about us:

MobSquad solves the significant and growing technology talent shortage faced by US-based start-ups and scale-ups by enabling our clients to quickly have a turnkey "virtual" Canadian subsidiary, where Canadian-based software engineers serve our clients on an exclusive basis
We've been featured in The Globe and Mail, Calgary Herald, The Financial Times (UK), BetaKit, CBC, Global News, and many other places. We're most proud of our front-page article ( https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/trumps-immigration-policy-has-foreign-tech-talent-looking-north-of-the-border/2019/01/10/c199bf4a-03bb-11e9-958c-0a601226ff6b_story.html?utm_term=.3b6ccfd8da55 ) in The Washington Post, which garnered a tweet response from President Trump
We're a Certified B Corporation, were recognized as one of Canada's Best Places to Work in 2019, and have made a financial commitment to the Upside Foundation. We believe we are playing a key role in enhancing Canada's innovation economy, and have received financial support from the Government of Canada, Province of Alberta, Province of Nova Scotia, and City of Calgary, to support this ambition
You can learn more about us on our website ( https://mobsquad.io/ )

The Role
--------

You will lead a high-performing engineering team based in Canada working exclusively with an exciting US start-up or scale-up. Strong relationships and communication with other teams in the company will be essential to your success. Your team will operate alongside many other talented developers and data scientists in Canada, and you will be an integral part of the tech community that MobSquad has built.

Qualifications and Skills
-------------------------


Five or more years of experience leading engineering teams within an organization
Experience building and leading development teams of ten or more developers, while maintaining technical skills and applying them whenever necessary (i.e., coding and code reviews)
12 or more years of experience building and delivering excellent, user-friendly software
Experience with end-to-end software development and the complete lifecycle using Agile/Scrum development methodologies
12 or more years of experience writing production-ready code
Demonstrated ability to develop high-quality code adhering to industry best practices (i.e., code review, unit tests, revision control)
You are still hands-on in coding and enjoy spending at least 30% of your time in coding/code reviews
Mastery of high-level languages (e.g., Java, Scala, R, C++, C#)
Proven experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Flask, Ruby, JavaScript, Bash)
Experience with cloud-based services (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Google Platform, Microsoft Azure), Docker, and SQL/NoSQL databases
Demonstrated experience developing APIs, distributed systems, and back-end components
Work/project history reflective of a self-motivated professional who excels when given open-ended problems and broadly-defined goals, having an innate desire to leverage their skills in a way that provides business value
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a comparable field from an accredited institution

Who You Are
-----------


You are a self-starter who can work autonomously and drive success within your team
You have extensive leadership experience and have delivered exceptional results with your team
You understand that writing code is as much about functionality as it is about communication, and that shines through in the clarity of your code and how you describe it to your teammates
You are comfortable when things go according to plan, and you are energized when chaos strikes and the team's well-laid plans need to be overhauled
You know that start-up life involves continual adaptation and change, and that excites you!

What You'll Get @MobSquad
-------------------------


A full-time position that offers competitive compensation
A benefits program delivered through our bespoke digital platform, giving you control, choice, and flexibility. We give you the ability to build your package of benefits covering health (think medical, dental, vision), wellness (think gym, workout gear, ski pass, massage, transit) and RRSP (think retirement)
A downtown office location with first-rate amenities, surrounded by great restaurants and easily-accessible transit
Exposure and engagement with world-class start-ups where you will be helping to build the next big thing many times over
For international candidates: Sponsorship for an immediate work permit through Canada's Global Talent Stream and in many cases, expedited permanent residency and a path to citizenship

]

[Toronto, ONWhat We Are Building:
At Rubikloud, we are on a mission to bring “Intelligent Decision Automation” to the world’s largest enterprise retailers. Our platform unifies the latest in distributed systems, artificial intelligence, cloud architecture and some of the brightest minds to fulfill our mission. Over the past three years, we have been able to connect with over 150,000 retail point of sales location in 10 countries and create a database of over $100 billion in first party retail transactional data. And the numbers are only growing!
Who we are looking for:
We are looking for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Engineering team. In this role you will have the opportunity to work with various team members to execute on the Rubikloud vision. You will use your superb troubleshooting and analytic skills to ensure timely releases with highest quality possible, by working with cross functional teams and building automated test framework. Ideally, you are passionate about delivering in a fast-paced environment and learning new things.
Requirements
Who You Are:
Solid understanding of software testing methodologies and processes in agile development environment.
Exceptional Experience in UI Testing, API Testing, Backend Testing and ability to build strong Integration test suite
Proven experience in building / maintaining an automation framework using selenium with Java( Intermediate to expert Level required)
Experience in writing complex SQL queries as well as creation of functions and stored procedures
Experience in Jenkins Integration and job management
Experience in Testing multiple data migration projects
Experience working with Azure, AWS and/or GCP.
Ability to work in *nix environments.
Strong communication skills, able to clearly communicate with multiple lines of business autonomously
Nice to have knowledge of data analytics and skills of verifying complex data mappings
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent program.
Retail Industry experience is a plus
Experience with Spark , Kubernetes, Python is a plus
What You Will Do:
Build, automate and maintain QA environments.
Review product requirements and identify gaps and conflicts with the existing system.
Develop testing strategy, Create Test plans, Develop test cases and build test harness/framework for our product.
Collaborate with Client Solutions Manager, Technical Product Manger, Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Developers and other QAs to standardize and enforce QA process and test coverage.
Proactively log defects and work with developers to troubleshoot and verify fixes.
Report quality status and escalate issues effectively.
Support Production Maintenance
Benefits
Who We Are:
We are a group of intellectually curious people who are passionate about making a big splash in the world of retail. We offer competitive compensation including equity options - we want all the members of Rubikrew to own part of the Company. You will have a full health benefits package including extended health care, dental, vision etc. Lunch is catered Monday to Thursday so you won’t have to worry about packing a lunch! Healthy snacks and drinks are also provided to keep you energized. We want our employees to feel like they’re always developing personally and professionally so we offer a a personal development budget that you are free to use for knowledge expansion or as a fitness allowance.
Thank you to all who apply. We are only contacting applicants who are moving on to the next stage of the process. If you don’t hear from us, please check back for any future opportunities!
Rubikloud welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.]

Job_Title: Senior Scrum Master and Technical Project Manager
Job_Description:
[Montréal, QCDo you want to create engaging, helpful, and attractive websites that are frequented by millions of visitors worldwide? Autodesk’s Web Platform Engineering team is looking for a talented technical project manager/scrum master who is passionate about technology and agile practices to join our globally distributed team and help us develop beautiful, personalized web and ecommerce experiences.

You will lead the agile/scrum practice along with other scrum masters/TPMs to lead sprint teams into successful completion of sprints. You will also work with product owners and product managers to facilitate conversations within and outside of the sprint teams. Reporting to Manager of technical project management, you will also manage the project once the WPE team accepts it until we deliver it to the business.


You are someone who gets excited about creating great experiences for customers, is excited about technology (web) and believes in doing the right thing for the customers. You don’t get flustered by ambiguity and helps to resolve and simplify and isn’t afraid of reaching out to the right person to get answers.

Responsibilities
Be Agile champion and guide one or more teams in adaption of agile/scrum principles
Monitors team activity and guides workload commitments
Remove ambiguity by connecting with external teams or individuals so sprint progresses as schedule
Shield the team from external interferences that can jeopardize sprint goals
Keep team members engaged, involved and informed
Maintain data integrity, completeness and accuracy in team tools for work tracking and reporting
Ensure effective and efficient meetings such as stand-ups, sprint planning, release planning and retrospectives
Promote collective ownership of story completion and sprint goals
Ensure team understands and commits to specific sprint goals and follows through accordingly
Provide consistent and periodic project status to senior management
Escalate impediments that cannot be resolved by the sprint team
Manage project for the engineering team, partnering closely with external program and project managers
Coordinate cross-functional meetings to create project plans, release plans and other artifacts as needed

Minimum Qualifications
Highly motivated, self-driven and passionate about delivering great experiences
Structured and efficient in planning and coordination of projects and sprints
Ability to be the agile leader for the sprint and extended team, focusing on best-practices and principles
Mentor sprint teams and external members on agile/scrum principles
Strong written and oral communication skills
Expertise with various agile and software development tools (e.g. JIRA)
Demonstrable history of leading various agile/scrum projects for cross-functional and highly matrixed organizations
Able to influence and coach senior leadership on continually growing the agile practice

Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity and experience with Adobe AEM (CQ) and related technologies
PMP certification
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Certified Scrum Professional(CSP)

About Autodesk
With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world.
